intro: Melodorum wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Melodorum wallichii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
